metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4098 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The fallocate implementation in the GFS2 filesystem in the Linux kernel before 3.2 relies on the page cache, which might allow local users to cause a denial of service by preallocating blocks in certain situations involving insufficient memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4098` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.9
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
